intro: Epilobium himalayense, commonly known as Himalayan willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at high altitudes. The plant features upright stems covered in glandular hairs and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Epilobium himalayense is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
